moves.1. c4:
I'm not a great annotator, so I won't make too many notes; you can judge it for yourself.
I play white.
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 c6 3. e4 Bc5 4. Nf3 Qf6 5: the next 22 moves serve as a good example of why one should use his/her queen sparingly, lest they should lose her.
moves.12... Qe6 13. d5 cxd5 14. exd5 Qd7 15. e: why not Qxg4  ? why did my opponent wait two turns?
moves.26. Rh1 Rxh1 27. Kxh1 Qxg4 28. Be2 Qh5+: this is exactly the exesive trust in the queen that lost the game for my opponent.
moves.33. Rh6+ Kxh6 34. Qxf6+ Ng6: You have to admit, my opponent played out this position very well.
